name: Narrator
description: It reads and interacts with things on the screen, like text and buttons. Use Narrator to read and write email, browse the internet, and work with documents. Specific commands let you navigate Windows, the web, and apps. Navigation is available using headings, links, landmarks, and more.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use the Narrator screen reader in Windows 10 | Microsoft

name: VoiceOver
description: VoiceOver enables users with visual disabilities to control their computer using a rich set of keyboard commands and gestures. This chapter provides an overview of VoiceOver and key topics such as the VoiceOver cursor and current focus, keyboard shortcuts, and using function keys on some keyboards.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Navigate your iPhone or iPad with VoiceOver | Apple Support

name: TalkBack
description: Built-in screen reader and text-to-speech software for Android devices.

youTubeVideos.title: TalkBack - Accessibility on Android

name: NaturalReader
description: NaturalReader is a mobile app that can read aloud a variety of texts like PDFs, online articles, cloud documents, even images taken by your camera and so many more.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Natural Reader

name: Read&Write Gold
description: From reading on-screen text aloud to researching and checking written work, Read&Write Gold makes everyday tasks easier. It is a great tool for people with dyslexia and other learning difficulties, anyone whose first language isn't English, or for people that want to augment their writing skills. Users of all ages can access the reading, writing, studying, and research tools they need at school, home, or work. Having text read aloud with dual color highlighting, along with additional support tools, helps every learner gain confidence and work independently at their own pace.

youTubeVideos.title: Read&Write for exams | Talk&Type
Read&Write for exams | Text to Speech
How to use Exam Mode in Read&Write for Windows
Support for Read&Write Desktop overview
What's new with Read&Write for Windows

name: Balabolka
description: Balabolka is a Text-To-Speech (TTS) program. All computer voices installed on your system are available to Balabolka. The on-screen text can be saved as an audio file. The program can read the clipboard content, extract text from documents, customize font and background colour, control reading from the system tray or by the global hotkeys. Balabolka supports text file formats: AZW, AZW3, CHM, DjVu, DOC, DOCX, EML, EPUB, FB2, FB3, HTML, LIT, MD, MOBI, ODP, ODS, ODT, PDB, PRC, PDF, PPT, PPTX, RTF, TCR, WPD, XLS, XLSX.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Balabolka Text to Speech TTS Software

name: JAWS
description: JAWS is a screen reader for Microsoft Windows offered by Freedom Scientific, Inc. JAWS will assist users who are blind or low-vision to use a Windows computer. JAWS has a variety of features, including Braille support, multi-lingual speech synthesis, and multi-screen support.

youTubeVideos.title: Demonstration of JAWS screen reader

name: NVDA
description: NVDA (Non-Visual Desktop Access) allows blind and low vision people to access and interact with the Windows operating system and many third party applications.

youTubeVideos.title: Screen Reader Basics: NVDA -- A11ycasts #09

name: Kurzweil 3000
description: Help learners overcome challenges of all kinds, at any age, and on any device — from those learning English as a second language, to those living with dyslexia or low vision, to anyone struggling to achieve proficiency.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Use Kurzweil 3000

name: SuperNova
description: SuperNova is a range of assistive technology for people who are blind or partially sighted. You can rely on SuperNova to provide exceptional magnification, screen reading and braille support. It enables you to explore your computer screen and read on-screen information independently.

youTubeVideos.title: Dolphin SuperNova PC Magnifier And Screen Reader

name: ScreenReader
description: Dolphin ScreenReader is fast, reliable screen reading software for people who are blind or low vision.

youTubeVideos.title: Dolphin SuperNova PC Magnifier And Screen Reader

name: Publisher
description: Dolphin Publisher is specialist software that creates talking books. Alternatively you can create talking books in Dolphin Publisher with text files and synthetic human-sounding speech. Add visuals, images and navigation to suit your readers’ accessibility needs. Automated editing and customisable settings ensure that your readers always have the best listening experience.

youTubeVideos.title: Dolphin Easy Publisher

name: GuideConnect
description: Designed for people who are blind or low vision, GuideConnect helps people who are losing their sight stay independent for longer. It connects you to friends and family, and provides easy access to a range of entertainment.

youTubeVideos.title: Dolphin Guide Connect Demonstration

name: EasyConverted Express
description: Use EasyConverter Express to improve accessibility for people who are blind or low vision. EasyConverter Express quickly converts Microsoft Word documents into a variety of formats accessible to people who are blind or partially sighted.

youTubeVideos.title: EasyConverter Express & EasyReader—A Turn key Solution!

name: EasyReader
description: EasyReader is an accessible reading app designed to make reading eBooks and digital publications easier for people who are blind or low vision, have a print disability, or reading difficulties. It provides features like text-to-speech, customizable display settings, and navigation tools to improve the reading experience on various devices.

youTubeVideos.title: EasyConverter Express & EasyReader—A Turn key Solution!

name: Speak onscreen text
description: Even if VoiceOver is turned off, you can have iPhone read text on the screen out loud. Have iPhone read the entire screen or a specific selection. Or hear what you type spoken out loud, character by character or word by word.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Navigate your iPhone or iPad with VoiceOver | Apple Support
How to use Touch Accommodations on your iPhone or iPad | Apple Support

How to turn on Conversation Boost for AirPods Pro on iPhone and iPad | Apple Support
How to set up Assistive Access on your iPhone or iPad | Apple Support

name: Audio Descriptions
description: If you can’t see your screen and your content includes audio descriptions, you can listen to an audio description—a separate audio track that narrates or describes the visual content of a clip, show, or movie

youTubeVideos.title: How to Navigate your iPhone or iPad with VoiceOver | Apple Support

description: In the Magnifier app , you can use your iPhone as a magnifying glass to zoom in on objects near you. You can also use your iPhone to filter colors, add contrast, increase focus, and freeze frames.

name: Zoom In
description: In many apps, you can zoom in or out on specific items. For example, you can double-tap or pinch to look closer in Photos or expand webpage columns in Safari. You can also use the Zoom feature to magnify the screen no matter what you’re doing. You can magnify the entire screen (Full Screen Zoom) or magnify only part of the screen with a resizable lens (Window Zoom). And, you can use Zoom together with VoiceOver.

name: Use Darkmode
description: Dark Mode gives the entire iPhone experience a dark color scheme that’s perfect for low-light environments. With Dark Mode on, you can use your iPhone while, for example, reading in bed, without disturbing the person next to you.

youTubeVideos.title: How to Navigate your iPhone or iPad with VoiceOver | Apple Support

description: To make it easier to see what’s on your iPhone screen, you can invert and filter colors or make transparent items solid.

description: With Live Captions (beta) on iPhone, you can get a real-time transcription of spoken audio. Use Live Captions to more easily follow the audio in any app, such as FaceTime or Podcasts, and in live conversations around you.

description: iPhone can provide subtitles, closed captions, and transcriptions so you can follow along more easily with audio and video.

description: You can set the iPhone indicator light to blink when you receive a notification. This can be useful if you can’t hear the sounds that announce incoming calls or other alerts, or if you might miss audible alerts in a noisy environment.

description: Your iPhone can continuously listen for certain sounds—such as a doorbell, siren, or crying baby—and notify you when it recognizes these sounds.

name: Make Real-Time Text (RTT) calls
description: If you have hearing or speech difficulties, you can communicate by telephone using Teletype (TTY) or real-time text (RTT)—protocols that transmit text as you type and allow the recipient to read the message right away. RTT is a more advanced protocol that transmits audio as you type text.

description: You can use MFi hearing aids or sound processors with iPhone and adjust their settings. See the Apple Support article Made for iPhone compatible hearing devices for a list of models that work well with iPhone.

name: Live listen
description: You can stream sound from the microphone on iPhone to your MFi hearing devices or AirPods. This can help you hear better in some situations—for example, when having a conversation in a noisy environment.

name: Audio Balance
description: You can use mono audio, adjust left-right stereo balance, and—with supported headphones—amplify soft sounds and adjust certain frequencies to best suit your hearing needs. You can also use data from an audiogram to improve the accuracy and sound quality of your headphones.

description: You can have iPhone play ambient background sounds—such as ocean waves or rain—to help you focus or rest.

description: With Live Speech on iPhone, you can type and have your words spoken in person, on Phone and FaceTime calls, and in assistive communication apps using any of dozens of voices, including your Personal Voice. (Available in select languages.)

name: Personal Voice
description: If you’re at risk of speech loss or someone with a speech disability, you can create a personalized voice on iPhone to use with Live Speech. With Personal Voice, you can create a voice that sounds like your own to use to type to speak in FaceTime, Phone, and assistive communication apps. (Available in select languages.)

description: You can have Siri announce notifications and calls from apps like Messages on your iPhone speaker, supported headphones, when using CarPlay, and on MFi hearing devices.

name: Switch Control
description: Switch Control is an assistive technology for anyone with limited mobility. It enables you to interact with iPhone by activating a switch, such as pressing an external adaptive button, performing a head movement, or making a voiced or voiceless sound. Using one or more switches, you can navigate a cursor around the iPhone screen, then open the Scanner menu to choose an available action such as tap, zoom in, zoom out, and more.

name: ZoomText
description: ZoomText Magnifier/Reader is a fully integrated magnification and reading program tailored for low-vision users. Magnifier/Reader enlarges and enhances everything on your computer screen, echoes your typing and essential program activity, and automatically reads documents, web pages, email.

youTubeVideos.title: ZoomText App Reader

name: Fusion
description: Fusion is the ultimate accessibility tool for schools, agencies, training centers, and businesses where individuals with vision loss are served. Fusion provides the best of both worlds – ZoomText® , with its screen magnification and visual enhancements for screen viewing ease, coupled with the power and speed of JAWS®  for screen reading functionality.

youTubeVideos.title: xFont: ZoomText's Advanced Font Smoothing Technology
New Updates to Freeze View in ZoomText and Fusion 2023
True Center Tracking, now available on ZoomText and Fusion
True Center Tracking, now available on ZoomText and Fusion
ZoomText Demo: Favorite Zoom Levels

name: OpenBook
description: OpenBook converts printed documents or graphic-based text into an electronic text format on your PC, using high-quality speech and the latest optical character recognition (OCR) technology. OpenBook is innovative software designed to enhance success for people who are blind or have low vision who need access to printed and electronic materials. OpenBook and the PEARL document camera create a complete scanning and reading system for work, home, and school.

name: Dragon Professional v16
description: Dragon Professional v16 is software that lets you use your voice to control your computer and create documents. It's incredibly accurate, so you can dictate emails, reports, and even code without typing. This frees your hands and can be a major productivity boost, especially if you have difficulty typing or just want to work more efficiently.

youTubeVideos.title: Dragon Naturally Speaking Tutorial #1 (Professional Individual version 15)

name: Dragon Professional Anywhere
description: Dragon Professional Anywhere is a cloud-based app that lets you create documents, emails, and more using just your voice. It's like having a super-accurate personal assistant who types everything you say, no matter where you are or what device you're using. Plus, it syncs your work across all your devices, so you can seamlessly pick up where you left off, even on the go!

youTubeVideos.title: Introducing Nuance Dragon Professional Anywhere

name: Dragon Legal v16
description: Dragon Legal v16 is a speech recognition software program specifically designed for legal professionals. It is powered by Deep Learning technology, which allows it to achieve up to 99% speech recognition accuracy, even for speakers with accents or in slightly noisy environments.

youTubeVideos.title: Dragon Legal  - Quick setup with Voice Recognition

name: Dragon Anywhere Mobile
description: Dragon Anywhere is a smartphone app that lets you create and edit documents using just your voice. It's like having a super-accurate assistant that types whatever you say, even when you're not at your desk! You can dictate long reports, emails, or even fill out forms, all hands-free and on the go.

youTubeVideos.title: Dragon Anywhere - Professional-grade dictation on your mobile device

name: Dragon Medical One
description: Dragon Medical One is a cloud-based speech recognition software designed specifically for healthcare professionals. It allows clinicians to dictate notes, generate charts, and complete other documentation tasks using their voice, freeing up their time to focus on patient care.

youTubeVideos.title: Nuance - Dragon Medical One - Tutorial

name: AutoHotKey
description: AutoHotkey is a free, open-source scripting language for Windows that allows users to easily create small to complex scripts for all kinds of tasks such as: form fillers, auto-clicking, macros, etc.

youTubeVideos.title: AutoHotkey - Beginners tutorial (All the basic functions)

name: Helperbird
description: Our accessibility features, like dyslexia-friendly fonts, text-to-speech, and background color options, help individuals with dyslexia and visual impairments enjoy online content more easily and inclusively.

youTubeVideos.title: Helperbird - Accessibility, Productivity & Web Features Software - Overview

name: Dotepub
description: dotepub is software in the cloud that allows you to convert any webpage into an e-book.

name: Magnifier
description: Magnifier makes part or all of your screen bigger so you can see words and images better.

name: Dictation
description: With Dictation, you can enter text just by speaking, anywhere that you can type it.

name: FineReader PDF
description: AI-based OCR technology makes it easier to digitize, retrieve, edit, protect, share, and collaborate on all kinds of documents in the same workflow.

youTubeVideos.title: How to send scans from FineReader PDF for iOS to FineReader PDF for Windows - EN

name: FineReader Server
description: Deploy a server-based, large-volume OCR solution for document conversion.

name: Screnshot Reader
description: Capture text and tables without retyping.

name: ChromeVox
description: Chrome's built in screen-reader.

name: Voice Typing
description: Voice-to-text feature that allows users to type with their voice on a variety of devices and applications

name: Be My Eyes
description: Connect with Be My Eyes volunteers speaking 185 languages and available – for free – 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

name: Be My Eyes for Windows
description: The Be My Eyes app has been a long-time favorite for users of iOS and Android smartphones. Now get the same AI-powered visual interpretation and description of content on your desktop. From photos and graphs, to screenshots and business applications, Be My Eyes for Windows employs powerful AI models to deliver detailed descriptions, and present visual content in a more useful and accessible way.

name: Braille device
description: Attach a braille display so visually impaired students can participate in classroom activities

name: Capti Voice
description: Listen to documents, homework, the news,, etc. Capti will improve your productivity and make your reading more enjoyable. A great tool for students, language learners, commuters, busy professionals, retirees, people with dyslexia or other learning disabilities, and many more. Capti is your literacy and reading support tool.

name: Claro MagX
description: Claro MagX turns your iPhone, iPod Touch or iPad into a powerful high definition visual magnifier.

name: ClaroRead
description: Text-to-speech software designed to help users with reading, writing, and studying, particularly for individuals with dyslexia or other learning difficulties.

youTubeVideos.title: A Guide to ClaroRead

name: EquatIO
description: Math-to-speech with exam accomodations.

name: Color Inversion
description: Invert screen and text colors for sharper contrast and easier reading

youTubeVideos.title: Making Your Chromebook Easier to See

name: Bookshare Reader
description: Access millions of ebooks from Bookshare, the world's largest library of ebooks for people with reading barriers like dyslexia, blindness, low vision, and physical disabilities.

name: TapTapSee
description: TapTapSee is designed to help the blind and visually impaired identify objects they encounter in their everyday lives. Simply tap anywhere on the screen to take a picture. TapTapSee can photograph any two or three-dimensional object at any angle and speak the identification back to the user (Note: Spoken identification requires VoiceOver to be turned on).

name: Voice Dream - Natural Reader
description: Apple Design Award Winner! Voice Dream - Read Aloud lets you listen to PDFs, textbooks, Web pages, emails, and books using advanced AI Text To Speech!

name: AutoCorrect
description: Auto correct with vocabulary from over 130 subject dictionaries.

name: Glean
description: Cloud-based ntetaking tool

name: Select to speak
description: With select-to-speak, choose specific lines or sections of the screen to be read aloud. Help people with low vision

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Select-to-Speak on your Chromebook

name: VDWrite
description: Voice Dream Writer helps everyone write better: Text-to-speech proofreading reduces mistakes, phonetic and meaning search help you use the right words, and an active outline helps you organize and improve the structure of your writing.

name: TD Talk
description: Speech generating app for literate adults with communication disabilities such as ALS.

name: Boardmaker 7
description: Creating visual supports and communication materials, particularly for individuals with communication and learning needs.

name: Cash Reader Aid to the Blind
description: Just point your camera at any bill from over a hundred supported currencies and hear its value instantly.

name: NaviLens
description: NaviLens is a high-density artificial markers system for long distance reading. The tags generated by this system are designed in order to be read from a long distance, without the need of focussing and even in motion.

name: Read&Write for Windows
description: The Read&Write Desktop app is a toolbar students can download to their personal laptop. Read&Write includes many literacy tools including read aloud (text-to-speech), dictionary, picture dictionary, and highlighting. Read&Write is most commonly used by students with alternate format textbooks, but can be used with many desktop applications including Microsoft Office products.

name: Sero
description: A screen reader that provides accessible browsing, social networking, and cloud services for visually impaired users.

name: Ispeech Web Reader
description: Text-to-speech tool that reads web pages, documents, and PDFs aloud.

name: ClaroRead Pro
description: ClaroRead Pro text-to-speech software can be used to support those who struggle with print-based information.

youTubeVideos.title: A Guide to ClaroRead

name: Otter.ai
description: Otter provides faculty and students with real-time captions and notes for in-person and virtual lectures, classes or meetings.

name: Balabolka
description: Balabolka is a Text-To-Speech (TTS) program. All computer voices installed on your system are available to Balabolka. The on-screen text can be saved as an audio file. The program can read the clipboard content, extract text from documents, customize font and background colour, control reading from the system tray or by the global hotkeys.

name: Capti
description: Capti allows you to upload documents and process them into customizable text-to-speech documents that allow you to highlight, take notes, translate, define, manipulate the text, and much more.

name: WordQ
description: WordQ is a user-friendly writing software tool designed to empower students, facilitating the creation of higher-quality writing with increased independence and confidence. It offers ongoing support for students with learning differences (e.g., dyslexia) or physical disabilities, as well as any student encountering writing barriers. Additionally, it complements reading and writing instruction, particularly for students learning English or French as a second language.

name: Color Filters
description: If it's hard to see what's on the screen, apply a color filter. Color filters change the color palette on the screen and can help you distinguish between things that differ only by color.

name: Messenger Pigeon
description: Messenger Pigeon is a learning tool that allows users to capture and organize educational content, such as audio and video recordings. It offers automated transcription, captioning, AI-generated summaries and quizzes, and the option to get notes from your recordings written by a professional. It also provides an AI assistant that generates summaries, keywords, and quizzes to help with comprehension and retention. Additional features such as speed control and grammar check are also included.

youTubeVideos.title: Study Smarter With The Messenger Pigeon Mobile App
Meet Messenger Pigeon

name: Dasher
description: Dasher is designed to help people with physical difficulties and therefore this is where it is most accessible. It can be accessed using any pointing device but people are particularly excited about the use of eye tracking technologies. Although these systems are in their infancy a few are emerging that, coupled with Dasher, could provide severely disabled people with a method of producing text in a fast and comfortable manner. For those with decent head movement a head pointer could provide a cheaper, and more established, solution.

youTubeVideos.title: How to use Dasher with acessibility switches
